data.message: CSS is getting lot of hate cause it isn't science :) It's a bunch of hacks and methods you have to go through all of them and learn it "THE HARD WAY" :)
ديل عفريت ودهن نملة عيونها زرقا

By it isn't science I mean that it isn't like programming where you have set of rules and logic that behave exactly like what you expect no matter how many time you run it. A lot of factors affect CSS and rendering and here comes the frustration for many :) You have the global name space, anything can alter what you write ... You have a hostile environment -aka the browser- which people expect it to behave exactly the same no matter which verion is it ... Just like trying to run an HD movie on a black and white TV ... You have the cascade ... It's really hard to explain all that to a beginner :D
CSS.. Sandboxing all the efforts since 1994..

You learn about floats then you discover that you have to clear it. You try to create 3 columns layout then struggle to get the background to stretch vertically till you discover faux background method. You spend hours wondering why element { height : 100% ; } doesn't work as expected till you discover it will never work that way. You try to dock a footer to the bottom then you discover you have to apply certain markup and CSS to achieve that goal. There are lots and lots of hacks and workaround to get your basic layout to work that you need to understand before writing one line of CSS ...
معلش يا تيسير انت جيت على الجرح :D

Ahmad Alfy I still don't know why 100% height fails to work 99% of the times I try it :D
Edit: Unintended coincidence/pun here, sometimes 100% works but shows scrollbars, so I make it 99% and it works :D
